intro: Crassula scalaris, commonly known as the Stonecrop or Little Carpet Plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, rounded leaves that are typically green or bluish-green in color. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, pink or white flowers during the summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil. Crassula scalaris is often grown as a decorative plant in rock gardens or as a potted specimen due to its compact size and resilience.
